statement.p: Let U be a matrix whose columns are orthonormal. Let P = UU^T . Show that \Col(P) = \Col(U). Use the identity P^2 = P to show that the eigenvalues of P equal 0 or 1.
Let U be a matrix with U^T U=I. Explain why Ux\cdot Uy = x\cdot y for any vectors x, y. (Hint: use the identity Au\cdot v=u\cdot A^Tv)
Explain why Av\cdot u=v\cdot A^Tu for any vectors u, v and any matrix A (for which Av\cdot u make sense).

Let L be the line x=y in \R^2.
Compute the matrices for proj_L and proj_{L^\perp}.
Is proj_L or proj_{L^\perp} one-to-one?
What is the range of proj_L \circ proj_{L^\perp}?
What is proj_L \vec{2 1}?
